properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet weather expected to continue tonight and Saturday. A low pressure system over southwestern Nova Scotia will slowly cross the province tonight to lie northeast of the province on Saturday. Rain associated with this system will persist tonight and Saturday. Showers or periods of rain will persist Saturday night. Total rainfall amounts may reach or exceed 50 mm. Warnings may be extended to these counties with future updates. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-22T02:28:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T18:29:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2370003302.2019
Area: Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert For The Village Of Limerick
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued by the Water Security Agency for the Village of Limerick due to the power outages. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the tank loading site at the Fire Hall. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2019-06-27T13:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Limerick and RM of Stonehenge, 2019-06-21T11:53:50-06:00, E174CB29-31B0-024B-4C3E-77F62F4C0459
Area: Limerick
properties.Author: SK Limerick and RM of Stonehenge

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Cancelled
properties.Summary:
Description: This alert is being cancelled and the evacuation order for the area of Indian Cabins has been cancelled. The public can now return to this area and must be prepared to evacuate on short notice, and should continue to check the Mackenzie County Facebook page regarding fire activity in their area.### More information is also available at www.facebook.com/Mackenzie-County-262409787134568/ for Mackenzie County residents. Additional Wildfire information is also available at www.wildfire.alberta.ca website. Go to www.511.alberta.ca for up to date Road Report information.
Expires: 2019-06-21T19:12:15-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of Mackenzie County, 2019-06-21T18:57:15-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5868
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of Mackenzie County

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A slow moving low pressure system in Montana pushed a swath of precipitation into southern Saskatchewan today and will continue through the night and into Saturday. The main precipitation swath is forecast to remain over Shaunavon into the night and throughout Saturday before weakening Saturday evening. Today, rainfall reports throughout the region have been between 10 and 30 mm. Tonight, another 20 to 30 mm of rain is forecast. On Saturday, before the system begins to weaken, areas in the region could see an additional 10 to 15 mm. Leader and Swift Current have been added to the rainfall warning as satellite, radar, and current model guidance are indicating the swath of precipitation will remain over these regions throughout the night and into Saturday. These regions are forecast to receive 20 to 30 mm of rain this evening, and an additional 10 to 20 mm of rain on Saturday before the system begins to weaken. The main band of the precipitation swath has moved out of the Assiniboia region, but scattered showers will continue throughout the region this evening and into Saturday. Although the heaviest rain has moved out of the region, an additional 10 to 15 mm of rain is expected with the showers, so, the warning continues. The rainfall warning will likely be ended Saturday morning. It is worthy to note that within this system, there are pockets of heavier precipitation, therefore rainfall amounts will be highly variable across the regions. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-22T13:19:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T21:20:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1643752342.2019

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected or occurring. Strong southeasterly winds gusting up to 110 km/h will continue tonight. Winds are expected to diminish on Saturday morning as they become northeasterly. ### Very strong winds may push your vehicle around especially on roads through mountain passes and along deep valleys. Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-22T10:22:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T18:23:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0482171643.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long episode of rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system will continue to bring rain. Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 80 mm are expected with local accumulations possibly exceeding 100 in the Bow Valley region. Rain will end by the afternoon in Jasper and Nordegg and this evening along the southern foothills and in Calgary. Rain in Calgary will vary significantly with this event. Radar estimates show close to 50 mm of rain has occurred over the northwestern sections of the city while the southeast is closer to 10 mm. Rain continues over the northwest while the southeast is currently unlikely to see warning criteria rainfall with this event. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Be prepared for possible winter conditions at higher elevations. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-22T04:21:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T12:22:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4160736285.2019

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and reduced visibility at times. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-22T13:53:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-21T21:54:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1635653747.2019

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A slow moving low pressure system in Montana will drift into southern Saskatchewan later today. This weather disturbance will bring further rainfall to southern Saskatchewan today and tonight. The Assiniboia region as well as the Shaunavon region east of highway 37 are likely to see a further 30 to 40 mm of rainfall today but local amounts of 50 mm are possible. Thunderstorms are also expected in southwestern Saskatchewan today. Total rainfall amounts could be 20 to 40 mm in some slow moving thunderstorms. The rainfall will push northward tonight and Saturday will remain generally showery throughout southern Saskatchewan. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-22T08:15:45-00:00

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A low pressure system will slowly cross Nova Scotia today and pass to the northeast of the province on Saturday. Rain ahead of this system will weaken this morning across the province, but it will reintensify during the afternoon and evening. The rain will then taper to showers tonight and Saturday. Total rainfall amounts of around 50 mm are forecast, except in areas of heaviest rain, where amounts will be higher. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-22T02:35:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T10:36:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2584923896.2019
Area: Kings County, Annapolis County, Digby County, Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Pictou County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain will continue tonight, Saturday, and Saturday night. Additional amounts of 40 to 60 mm are expected before the rain tapers off to showers on Sunday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-22T10:24:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-21T18:25:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1059978382.2019
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada
